intro: Bredia rotundifolia, commonly known as the round-leaf bredia, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its small, round leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests or along stream banks. Bredia rotundifolia is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
